name: Jade
description_html: Who loves movie night?! Jade does and she's looking for a couch potato buddy. She's also the hostess with the mostest - she loves having people over and is great at making sure everyone feels welcome! Her foster friends say, "Jade is house trained and low key in the house. She is not destructive & can be left alone, and she enjoys cuddling but is not super pushy. This girl loves to nap and loves to eat! AKA she is super easy to please. She also sleeps through the night like a gem and has to be woken up by her humans for breakfast. Jade lived with a toddler for 2 weeks and was incredibly gentle. Jade loves to sunbathe and chill in the backyard. She gets excited to zoom around when given the opportunity, but then reverts back to her calm, cuddly self in the house. Jade's only "difficult" trait, which I assume is the reason she has yet to be adopted, is that she does need to be in an only pet home. However, with a family with a yard and no other pets, she would be the easiest dog ever and best companion!"

name: Huey
description_html:
Once a nervous pup, Huey has blossomed into a happy, 45-pound bundle of energy who can‚Äôt wait to get outside, grab a toy, and stretch his legs. Volunteers adore his goofy zoomies and the way he leans in for butt scratches‚Äîhis favorite ‚Äúsweet spot.‚Äù


Huey walks nicely on a mostly loose leash and doesn‚Äôt pay much attention to other dogs while out and about. He knows some commands and loves to play, especially once he‚Äôs comfortable. Though he may be shy with new people at first, he warms up beautifully with patience and gentle introductions.


After a long stay at the shelter, Huey is ready to leave the past behind and find a loving forever home where he can finally relax, play, and just be himself.

name: Trap
description_html:
Affectionately called "Dorito Ears,"


Trap is very smart and knows the common commands. He would also want to let you know that he would love to learn more from you! His favorite things in the world are discovering balls in the yard and his friends.


This cuddle bug would like an medium/active energy owner. By this we mean, you either love walks or would fit him into your gardening time in the yard. He would know how to self entertain with balls/toys as you garden, but sometimes would come in check with you to make sure you know he's still your garden pal.


Treat motivated and Dog selective, Trap can be friends with his peers with proper introductions. He trusts the humans he knows and will slowly warm up to strangers.


Once he gets some of his energy out, Trap is very content just relaxing, check in for some pets, napping, and playing with his toys. He also loves to snuggle. Trap is very house trained and rides well in the car. He is a very smart cookie and loves puzzle games too! He will thrive with an active person who will engage his body and his brain.


Come meet Trap soon! If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey.


If you've read this far, here are some unique quirks Trap has. He is afraid of sizzling noise of kitchen cooking, curious about dish washer, and is not a fan of the vacuum sounds. Will gather most of his toys into a place he's identified as his safe space / nap spot / or eating place. Knows the words home, find it, and inside + up/down. Understands Let's go/ walkie. Has a strong sit and lay down command is still being worked on.

name: Meshe
description_html:
Meshe is a fun loving girl. She has the best smile that'll brighten your day! Meshe has been in foster living with another dog for awhile now and has great home notes. She loves to cuddle with the resident dog and foster mom says Meshe is very chill at home, that she likes to sleep alot.

Meshe loves playing with squeaky toys and chewing on elk antlers, but is definitely not a fan of small animals. So, she'd be best with dog only families and no cats or rabbits. Reach out to the behavior team to set up a meet and greet with your dog(s) today.

Meshe also enjoys outings and car rides. She behaves well in the car, happily lying in the backseat, looking out the window.

Meshe would be a great hiking buddy. She really enjoys a good adventure! Her only hang up is no water sports. She's content to run around with her toys instead.

Meshe is a long stay pup that been fortunate to be living in a foster home these past 2 years, but her wish would be to find a loving, forever home with another dog to play with. Meshe is a cuddler and would love to snuggle next to you in bed. She truly is a joy to be around. Meshe will make you laugh and steal your heart.

name: Teddy Bear
description_html:
Meet Teddy Bear ~

He has 9 years of wisdom, complimented by loving foster home experiences. He's well rounded, smart, wise and listens well. He's perfectly healthy too. He's perfectly house trained and stays home alone well for long hours doing his favorite independent activities, playing with his toys, his puzzles and napping. Need an alerter? He's happy to comply and of course he'll still be friendly with your visitors. He's not demanding or fussy at all and loves affections when you are ready to dish them out.

Like to just take rides for burgers or coffee? He would love to be your ride along.

There are just two things that are must haves for his home:

A home with a fenced yard, or if no yard, peaceful walks

He requests the honor of peace, in being your only pet


This is your "one and done", your "ride or die", Teddy is your guy, through thick and thin. Why not give him a try? Foster trial to adopt is an option too. He's advocated for by ClassicCaninesATX and his adoption comes with extra support for a new stash of toys and a future vet care credit so he's easy to get established in a new home.

name: Cooper
description_html: Looking for a low key wise ole' guy for your companionship? Cooper is chiseled, handsome, wise and sweetly soft. He enjoys a gentle, quiet and easy approach that matches his outlook on life. Cooper has been in a foster home where he has the benefit of his foster and a canine friend for companionship. He also lives with an older child. His energy is on the lower side and of course he's a solid believer in beauty naps. He'll gently put his paws in your lap to ask you for some affections. And with age comes wisdom, he's able to manage himself well when home alone and is very house trained. Now and then he may enjoy a toy or a chew. He likes leisurely short walks with his people when that's in the cards. He's just as happy with a little time spent in a fenced yard space, He's not bothered by the occasional squirrels and cats he sees. Are you looking for a gentle friend like Cooper? Use the link to start a conversation with his foster provider.

name: Jack
description_html:
Jack's had a challenging life. His people couldn't care for him, which brought him to the shelter about a dozen times over the years. Jack learned how to cope and tolerate life's storms. To say the least, he's resilient. He's great with all people, little and big. Jack is now looking for his forever home as a senior dog. We would like for him to finally have a chance at a regular dog's life. He deserves that.

His friends at ClassicCaninesATX are ready to help him, now we just need the person who wants to make a difference in this happy guys' life. Jack doesn't have to accept life laying down in a shelter - he can have a good life outside of the shelter walls, a time very well spent.

Jack loves people best, big families, little families, people of all ages. He's a champion snuggler and TV watcher and would love a spot simply hanging out in a living room. He's not a fan of cats at all but has some light dog experience and could work well with a calm, easy dog in the home- we can schedule a doggie meet up at the shelter.

Time is on the clock for Jack so don't miss out and don't skip over Jack if you're ready to help change a life forever more to give Jack the stable home life he's never had.

name: Marina
description_html:
Meet Marina

You'll love Marina - she's sweet, sensitive, a cuddler, a player, a great all around companion. She's thrived in a multi-dog home, and in a home with just one other dog.

She's a great size and nice middle age of wisdom - you can take her just about everywhere but she also stays home alone very well.

Marina is being treated for a touch of anemia and will soon be healthy again if you don't mind waiting just a bit, we'll get it sorted out. Her advocates at ClassicCaninesATX are helping her meet her health goals. To learn more contact caring@classiccanines.org

name: Chiquita
description_html: Chiquita is a sweetheart who is ready for her forever home! She is currently in a foster home in an apartment setting. She is a lower energy dog. Never had an accident. Not destructive. Fine home alone while her foster mom works her 9-5 job. Very friendly and loves everyone she's met. She loves lounging outside and short walks. She's a fan of hanging out on the couch & watching TV with her foster-mom. She gets bursts of energy in the evening where she may want to play. She was recently watched by a foster sitter with a 4 year old and 8 year old child who also has a young medium sized dog & senior small dog & Chiquita did great there! She would do well in a lot of different home environments. She came in to the shelter with another dog who she'd previously been living with but he has already been adopted. Chiquita is a very adaptable lady who would love her forever home. She is advocated for by ClassicCaninesATX who are helping to make bridges out of shelters for displaced mature pets.

name: Bertha
description_html:
Looking for a loyal sidekick who will always keep you in her sights? Bertha is a people-focused pup who loves nothing more than checking in with her humans to make sure everyone‚Äôs happy. On walks, she‚Äôll glance up often with her big, adoring eyes just to say, ‚ÄúYou good? I‚Äôm good.‚Äù


When it‚Äôs playtime, she‚Äôs all about fetch, and if there‚Äôs water nearby, prepare to see pure joy. Bertha is a total water baby who could spend hours splashing and swimming.


With her affectionate nature and zest for fun, Bertha is ready to bring endless love, laughter, and poolside memories to her forever family.

name: Candy Land
description_html:
I've been fostering Candy Land for the last few months and she is such a sweet girl! Candy Land is house trained, not destructive, and great in a kennel for long periods of time. She has a good balance of energy to play in the yard and a healthy love for napping. She will greet you every morning with full body wiggles and a smile! (Yes, an actual smile!)

Candy Land knows how to sit and how to go get in her spot, whether that's her bed or her spot on the couch. She has been taught food manners; she will sit and wait until you say yes before eating her meal. She is very food motivated, which is great for training and nail trimming, but don't leave food trash out because she'll happily vacuum up every last morsel! She gently accepts treats and doesn't beg while you finish a meal; a true lady.

She would be a great family dog as she does well around older kids. She is dog selective, but has lived with other dogs well matched. She loves car rides and will sit well in the front or the back seat. She even enjoys the window down a little bit!

Fun facts about Candy Land are she does well around farm animals, can bounce on a trampoline, and only barks at the scary Amazon delivery man!

Candy Land was in the shelter for a long period of time, but has really opened up in foster care to show what a sweet and loving girl she is. Please reach out if you're ready to give this sweet girl the forever home she's looking for!

name: Stax
description_html:
This handsome Shepherd-Cattle Dog mix (DNA in photos!) has spent over a year at the shelter, but outside those walls, he‚Äôs pure gold. Stax is house-trained, calm, and melts into a snuggly, affectionate companion once he‚Äôs in a home. Volunteers call him ‚Äúan utter delight‚Äù and ‚Äúone of the easiest dogs here.‚Äù

He loves stuffies, snacks, and squirrel watching. Stax walks well in quiet spaces (can be vocal if passing dogs). He's an A+ cuddle buddy who loves quiet, cozy homes.

Stax is also eligible for VIP Adoption, which gives prospective adopters a 30-day trial period to welcome him into their home and make sure it‚Äôs a great long-term match. It‚Äôs the perfect way to get to know this big-hearted boy and see just how easy he is to love.

name: Geedorah
description_html:
Geedorah (GeeGee for short) has the most striking eyes. Combine those eyes with fun merle spots on her head and she's one beautiful pup!

This sweet gal starts out a little shy then really starts to shine once she gets to know you, accepting gentle pets and nicely taking treats. GeeGee loves other dogs-she immediately became fast friends with her foster brother, running around the backyard and playing. She likes but is also respectful of her two elderly, smaller foster sisters when they don't want to play. She was a little interested in her foster guinea pig siblings at first, but once they were shown to her up close, she lost interest. So no problem for her if there are small animals in the house.

Miss GeeGee is a smart cookie. She learned the dog door in two days from watching her siblings. She's also crate trained and is comfortable in her crate overnight or during the day when her people are at work.

If you like walks, this girl can be your best buddy! She easily keeps up with her foster mom for 2-3 miles. GeeGee is also happy to chill with her family. She's really starting to enjoy and seek out couch cuddles both with her people and her foster siblings. The middle of a cuddle puddle is now one of her favorite spots! Geedorah can also entertain herself with toys (stuffies and ropes) and chew treats like benebones. Since she's four years old, she's past the crazy puppy energy but still has many years to love her forever family.

At a compact 35 pounds, Geedorah is the perfect size for any household. Come meet this amazing girl and fall in love with your new best friend!

Check out Geedorah's Instagram: @adopt_GeeGee_dog

name: Remi
description_html:
Meet Remi ~ the lady shepherd ~


How will she fit in your home?

‚Ä¢ Her energy level is low-med and easy going

‚Ä¢ She self-entertains with her favorite toys-she's goofy and cute as she tosses and catches them, sometimes she carries them off to bed with her

‚Ä¢ She's super house trained

‚Ä¢ Easy on a leash (unless she sees a critter)

‚Ä¢ She stays home alone well and loves having a crate den to retreat to when she wants to

‚Ä¢ Asks before she gets on furniture

‚Ä¢ Loves to stay close to her people


What does Remi say BOO to?

‚Ä¢ Critters of all kinds including cats

‚Ä¢ She really does want to be the only animal critter in her home and she tells us age should have some privileges with it so she can enjoy her silver years without any drama


Remi is advocated for by her foster teams and ClassicCaninesATX. Her adoption package in 2025 comes with an eGift Card for a new toy stash and a veterinary care credit of $150 to get her onboarded with her new owner's preferred provider. Start a conversation with her fosters by clicking on her link.

name: Dietrich
description_html: Hi! My name is Dietrich. That means "ruler of the people" in German. My foster parents gave me that name since I spent my life being so powerless, now it is my time to learn what it's like to have power. I had a very rough first half of life, and am ready to be loved. I finished all of my medical treatment and am a very healthy boy. I am starting to realize the world isn't so scary. I am still a bit nervous, but love being pet and chilling out with a chew stick. I like to stay glued to someone's leg when I am on the leash and am great about going to the bathroom outside. My foster cat and dog brothers are both spooky to me even when they stand still so I ignore them. My foster rabbit brother isn't as scary to me though. I am gaining a love for life and am looking for my forever human or humans to spend the rest of my life with. I will be your sweetest and most loyal family member!

name: Buddy
description_html:
Meet Buddy - life is getting better and better - want to be part of his glow up? His  person will understand it's all uphill from being lost, underweight and being in survival mode. He's having what may be his first chance at a normal dog's life and doing great! He's living in a foster home where he's proven to be very housetrained, for a full work day. He enjoys the security of his crate sometimes  and isn't anxious at all to be left alone and simply sleeps the time away. He does enjoy sleeping by his person if allowed. He likes baths and has learned a love of some toys and short zoomie sessions in the yard. He's been a joy for his foster to watch unfold now that he doesn't have to figure out the basics of life for himself. Reach out to learn more. He's had some light experience around dogs including a smaller dog, and has not yet met cats. A meet and greet with a resident dog can be scheduled at the shelter. Reach out to inquire on his link. 


Attributes:
Housetrained
Leash trained
Cuddler
Low energy
Playful

name: Hero
description_html: Meet Hero, a gentle giant with a heart full of love! This big boy is a sweet and affectionate pup who just wants to be loved. While he can be a little timid at first, he is incredibly gentle and eager to please. Once he opens up, he is the ultimate cuddle companion, happily curling up on the couch for some quality snuggle time. He also has a playful side and likes to explore new toys. His curiosity makes every walk an adventure, as he takes in all the sights and smells around him. Despite his initial shyness, Hero is a quick learner and always ready to impress. He has already mastered "sit" and "stay" before meals, showing just how smart and willing he is to learn. He thrives on patience and kindness, and his confidence continues to grow every day. Whether he's out exploring or lounging at home, he is the perfect balance of playful and affectionate. If you're looking for a loyal, loving companion with a gentle soul, Hero is ready to steal your heart!

name: Bruce
description_html:
Looking to add more joy, presence, and sunshine to your life? ‚òÄÔ∏èüåπ

Then it‚Äôs time to stop and smell the roses‚Ä¶ and meet Bruce!

Welcome to the wonderful world of Bruce ‚Äî a place where belly rubs are currency, fetch is a national sport, and love is always in the air. To enter, you‚Äôll need just a few essentials:

‚úîÔ∏è Hands for belly rubs

‚úîÔ∏è Tennis balls for endless games of fetch

‚úîÔ∏è A pocket full of treats (because Bruce is a firm believer in snack-based diplomacy)

Bruce is a handsome, high-energy guy who‚Äôs all about his people and living life to the fullest. Whether it‚Äôs hiking trails, exploring new parks, or just being your co-pilot for the everyday moments, Bruce is always up for the ride. He‚Äôs dog-selective, so slow intros or a solo-pet home may be best‚Äîbut when it comes to humans, he‚Äôs all in.

If you‚Äôre searching for a loyal sidekick, an enthusiastic adventure buddy, and a reason to smile every day, Bruce might just be your perfect match. Come join Bruce World‚Äîit‚Äôs full of tail wags, playful zoomies, and unconditional love. üíõ


Email blueplusbusters@gmail.com for more info!

name: Cranberry
description_html: The heart on her nose is no joke, Cranberry is truly full of love. If you're looking for a companion to greet you like you're in the honeymoon phase for life, this is your girl. If you're looking for a girl who trots right by your side, this is your girl. If you're looking for a calm, peaceful, and aware presence while exploring the outside world together, this is your girl. If you're looking for a partner who can be nervous at times, but calmed but your validating words, pets, and built trust, this is your girl. If you're looking for a pet who gets excited about adventures and just being together, this is your girl. If you're looking for a pup who appreciates human company, company of other nice dogs, chew toys, walks, close snuggles, treats with tricks and great listening skills, this is your girl. If you're looking for a young dog who is beautiful inside and out, this is your girl.

name: Dandelion
description_html:
After nearly a year in the shelter, Dandelion has truly blossomed into a playful, affectionate, and downright joyful companion. At two years old, this cuddlebug and zoomie enthusiast is soaking up every bit of life on the outside‚Äîand he‚Äôs ready to share it all with his forever family.

Dandy is a social pup who loves chasing balls, splashing in a kiddie pool, going for walks, and tagging along on whatever adventure the day brings. When it‚Äôs time to relax, he‚Äôs all about the snuggles‚Äîcurling up beside you and soaking in the love like it‚Äôs his favorite treat.

He gets along well with other dogs and thrives with a little mealtime structure‚Äîcurrently enjoying his meals in a quiet spot to help him feel calm and secure. After eating, he heads out for a quick potty break before jumping back into the fun. He‚Äôs doing wonderfully with potty training, going up to 8 hours accident-free during the day and even longer overnight. He sleeps soundly on a couch, dog bed, or right next to you if invited.

Dandelion walks beautifully on a harness and shorter leash, exploring the world at your side with curiosity and calm. He‚Äôs smart, eager to engage, and channels his energy into all the right things‚Äîlike enrichment toys, frozen carrots, stuffed Kongs, Chuck-It balls, and durable chews. He redirects easily and is always up for learning.

Because of an old vocal cord injury, Dandy doesn‚Äôt bark loudly‚Äîbut he makes up for it with happy wiggles, soulful eyes, and gentle energy that speaks volumes. He‚Äôll thrive with continued consistency, love, and either leashed adventures or a secure yard to safely enjoy the outdoors.

Dandelion is that rare blend of fun-loving and affectionate, making him the perfect hiking buddy, poolside pal, and loyal snuggle partner. He‚Äôs bloomed beautifully‚Äînow all he needs is a home where he can keep growing, loved and safe.


If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Muffin
description_html:
Meet Muffin!

This sweet, gentle girl is the perfect mix of affectionate, loyal, and adventurous. She adores people of all ages (including toddlers!) and gets along wonderfully with other dogs‚Äîespecially her two large lab foster siblings. While she hasn‚Äôt been cat-tested, she‚Äôs calm and respectful around everyone she meets.

Muffin is medium energy: she enjoys her walks, hikes, and backyard zoomies, then is content to nap and hang out quietly. She walks beautifully on a leash and loves to take in the sights and smells‚Äîespecially during a neighborhood patrol (she takes her role as squirrel chaser and lawn-watering observer very seriously).

She‚Äôs happy to accompany you to pet stores, hiking trails, or a lazy day on the couch. At home, she likes being near you but isn‚Äôt clingy. She sleeps soundly through the night in her own space, but comes in for snuggles and kisses when the alarm goes off‚Äîespecially to remind you it's breakfast time.

Muffin is house-trained, allows bathing and nail trims, and is very food motivated (favorites: apples, carrots, peanut butter, cheese‚Äîyou name it!). While she was in rough shape when she arrived‚Äîunderweight, untrained, and recovering from illness‚Äîshe‚Äôs now healthy, spayed, vaccinated, and thriving.

She does have some separation anxiety, especially during long absences, and is on a daily med to help. She‚Äôs an angel when her person is home and does fine for short outings with the company of her dog friends. Muffin would do best with someone who‚Äôs home often‚Äîretired or working from home‚Äîwho‚Äôs looking for a devoted companion to share their day with.

Muffin‚Äôs breed mix includes Australian Cattle Dog, Great Pyrenees, Pit Bull, German Shepherd, and ‚ÄúSupermutt‚Äù‚Äîa one-of-a-kind blend for a one-of-a-kind pup.

Her foster mom says: ‚ÄúIf I could change my work schedule, I would adopt her in a heartbeat. She‚Äôs the most loving, loyal little dog I‚Äôve ever met.‚Äù

If you're interested in learning more or meeting Muffin, please click on the "Get Started" button now!

name: Lady
description_html: Lady is a playful, sweet, loving Black Mouth Cur mix. She is very housetrained and looooves people! Lady loves to go on walks, run around the play yard, play fetch, and say hi to every human she sees. She is treat motivated, very curious, and eager to learn new tricks and please her human. Lady is a snuggly, cuddly girl, and very affectionate. This playful, loving girl loves to sit in her human's lap and give all the kisses and she'd prefer to be your one and only so she can soak up ALLL the love you have to give. Lady is an all around gem and is ready and waiting for her forever home and people to love on! Come meet Miss Lady girl today, she's waiting for you!

name: Draco
description_html:
Draco is a gorgeous black dog with fur like velvet.

He's still young, at 1 year old, but he already walks well on a leash and is dog compatible! Draco is looking for a family who will spend time with him, building his confidence and teaching him about the world. He's a very sweet boy that so wants to be with his people.

We think Draco would make a great around town pup, that you could take anywhere that's pet friendly. He loves to play in water! Draco may seem like a lot of energy in his kennel, but that's only because he wants to be out and with you. It's stressful living in a loud kennel. He's a sensitive soul that would make a special companion to any household. He crates himself for meals to wait on his food. And Draco knows Sit, Bed, Touch, and can sometimes Stay.

So, if you're looking for a friend till the end, then Draco is your boy!

If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Loretta
description_html:
Step aside, world ‚Äî Loretta has arrived, and she knows she‚Äôs fabulous. This petite pit bull mix might be medium in size, but her personality could fill a stadium. She‚Äôs smart, sassy, and her endearing personality has amassed her a whole fan club of volunteers at the shelter. Once you‚Äôre in Loretta‚Äôs circle, you‚Äôre in for life ‚Äî she‚Äôll shower you with love, loyalty, and a few dramatic head tilts for good measure.


Loretta recently went on a field trip and had an absolute blast: she played with toys, had her own spa day with a bath, strutted her stuff in the backyard like it was Paris Fashion Week, and rode in the car like a curious co-pilot. She insisted on sitting upright to look out the windshield ‚Äî because, of course, the star needs to see where the chauffeur is taking her.


She‚Äôs also a smart cookie! During a sleepover with a volunteer, Loretta showed she‚Äôs quickly picking up on house training, is crate trained, and loves having a comfy spot to curl up after a day of adventures.


If you‚Äôre looking for a dog who will make you laugh every day, love you endlessly, and add a little sparkle (and sass) to your life, Loretta is your girl.

name: Toby
description_html:
Meet Toby ‚Äî a 1¬Ω-year-old pittie mix who‚Äôs basically conducting a live study in the chemistry of connection.

At the shelter, all of Toby‚Äôs feelings show up at once: enthusiasm, hope, and a big dose of ‚Äúnotice me!‚Äù energy. But when he gets to spend time in a home or quiet space, you can see the transformation ‚Äî his nervous system settles, his body softens, and he remembers how to just be.

Toby‚Äôs a sensitive, emotionally intelligent pup who‚Äôs still learning to regulate those big young-dog feelings. With gentle structure and patient, kind humans, he thrives. He loves cheese-based positive reinforcement, cuddle research, and checking whether his people are still within a 20-foot radius.

If your love language is steady affection and snack-based encouragement, you might just be Toby‚Äôs perfect co-researcher.

üëâ Toby‚Äôs eligible for VIP Adoption, which includes a 30-day trial at home ‚Äî your chance to run your own heart experiment.

If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Mini
description_html:
Mini arrived to the shelter after being found on her own, underweight and very visibly a former momma dog. Her foster says: "As a volunteer dog walker, she stole my heart and has brought us so much joy in foster the last 5 months. She‚Äôs so snuggly, playful, and funny - greeting us with happy howls and lots of wiggles. She gets along well with our resident dog and seems to want to play with other dogs we encounter, but would need a meet & greet to make sure any fur siblings are a good match. She‚Äôs been through a lot and deserves a great home."

Reach out on her link to connect with her foster and make plans for a meet up.

name: Schnucki
description_html: Schnucki is a playful and endearing puppy with a lively spirit and a heart brimming with affection. With boundless puppy energy, he loves playing with toys, going on walks, and is always eager to make new friends. Whether he's chasing butterflies or reveling in the scent of wildflowers, his curiosity and joy are truly infectious. Think Jack Russell's energy in the cutest package! Affectionate and gentle, Schnucki craves companionship and will always seek out his people for snuggles and attention. He's a social soul with dog experience, happily enjoying playgroups and getting along wonderfully with humans and fellow pups alike. With his soft white fur and an irresistibly boopable brown spot atop his head! If you're looking for a lively, loving companion who will keep you entertained and shower you with affection, Schnucki might just be the perfect fit.

name: Kane
description_html:
Kane‚Äôs foster says ‚ÄúKane is an excellent house guest! He‚Äôs fully house-trained, can be left alone uncrated, and has had zero issues in the home. Our resident dog is having surgery soon, and we‚Äôre hoping to find a foster takeover for Kane so he doesn‚Äôt have to return to the shelter.

Kane currently lives peacefully with smaller dogs, previously lived with a seven-year-old child, did well on his cat test recently, greets new humans with happy full-body wiggles, and settles easily into home life (soft rugs and toys are his happy place!).

He‚Äôs great in the car, non-reactive on walks, knows basic commands, and enjoys a good balance of couch potato time and play ‚Äî especially fetch with tennis balls. Kane is affectionate, cuddly once he knows you, and overall just a low-maintenance, sweet companion.

If you can help find a foster takeover (or know someone who might be a good fit to potentially adopt!), please reach out. Kane truly deserves to keep enjoying life outside the shelter.‚Äù

name: Piggle
description_html:
This soulful gray pittie is a hidden gem. In his kennel, he might seem quiet and reserved, but outside he blossoms into a new dog. He loves walks, splashing in water, and showing off his goofy side with toys (his favorite game is fetch with two tennis balls). Volunteers describe him as affectionate, cuddly, and easy to handle.


Piggle does best with structure and may need some guidance around sharing his toys, but with patience, he‚Äôll reward you with love and loyalty.


He‚Äôs housetrained, leash-trained, and ready to leave shelter life behind for good!

name: Galleta
description_html:
She‚Äôs a gentle, dog-friendly girl who does best when she can take a moment to size things up. With new people she may hang back at first, watching and thinking ‚Äî but once she decides you‚Äôre safe, she loosens right up and her playful side comes out fast.


With dogs, she reads the room well and enjoys having canine friends around. With humans, she just asks for a little patience at the beginning. After that, she‚Äôs silly, sweet, and happy to be part of the fun. When it comes to walks, Galleta is in her element ‚Äî she loves long, sniffy strolls where she can take her time and explore the world with her nose.


If you appreciate a dog who unfolds at her own pace and then reveals a bright, bouncy personality, Galleta is exactly that kind of soul.

name: Lelee
description_html:
Lelee is a sweet, calm, and lovable companion looking for her perfect forever home. With her gentle, low-to-medium energy, she‚Äôs the ideal pup for someone who wants a peaceful, steady friend by their side. She walks beautifully on leash‚Äîno pulling, just happy strolls and tail wags all the way.

Lelee is house trained and knows basic commands (and maybe even more than she lets on!). She prefers to be the only pet in the home so she can soak up all the love, but she does great meeting other dogs or cats politely on leash outside the home.

This always-smiling girl is ready to bring warmth, joy, and endless tail wags to her new family.

Come meet her today‚Äîshe can‚Äôt wait!

name: Vivian
description_html:
At just a year old, Vivian has spent most of her life at the shelter.


When she first arrived, she was a shy, trembling stray who didn‚Äôt know how to trust people. But with love and patience from kind humans at the shelter, she‚Äôs growing into a playful pup who‚Äôs always happy to meet new friends.


Vivian has gone on long hikes with volunteers and loves to swim! She checks in with her people often and soaks up praise and pets. She is housetrained, loves treats, and walks beautifully on leash once she gets past her initial excitement.


Come meet Vivian today!

name: Finn
description_html: Finn is a 1.5 year old 50 pound pup with a great smile. He is house-trained and crate-trained. He is currently learning to walk on a leash. Finn is extremely wary of strangers and needs time to get to know new people, but if you have the patience to let him get to know you he will give you his whole heart! Finn would do best in a household with another dog he can bond with-doggy friends give him confidence!

name: Estrella
description_html:
Meet Estrella, a beautiful German Shepherd with a bright spirit to match her name. This smart, active girl loves nothing more than a good game of fetch and is always ready to show off her playful side.


Estrella enjoys staying engaged, whether that‚Äôs chasing a ball, exploring her surroundings, or spending time with people who appreciate her loyal and affectionate nature. She also gets along well with other dogs, making her a great candidate for a home with a canine companion.


Estrella recently went on an outing to Mueller and did wonderfully, showing off her good manners and adaptability in a new environment. She handled the adventure like a pro, taking in the sights and sounds while staying calm and confident. Estrella would thrive in a home that can give her regular exercise, enrichment, and plenty of love. If you‚Äôre looking for a fun, friendly, and devoted companion, Estrella may be the perfect match.

name: Yola
description_html:
Meet Yola, a soft, sweet girl with the gentlest heart and the silkiest fur. She‚Äôs the kind of dog who leans into your hand for pets and looks up at you with big, trusting eyes, just happy to be near her person.

She also rides perfectly in the car ‚Äî she hops in, sits down, and just enjoys the ride. During an overnight in an apartment, she was just as easy: she settled in beautifully, loved to cuddle, and slept soundly through the night.

On walks, Yola is a dream. She pads along politely and rarely pulls. She doesn‚Äôt pay much attention to other dogs, but squirrels and lizards? They have her full attention. üòÑ Yola takes her lizard-patrol duties very seriously and perks right up when she spots one darting across the sidewalk or rustling in the bushes. It‚Äôs her one silly, spirited hobby, and it never fails to make people smile.

Yola is looking for a family who will appreciate her gentle nature, enjoy her funny little lizard-hunting bursts, and give her the love and security she deserves.

name: Handsome
description_html:
Handsome is a chiweenie mix of about 7 yrs of wisdom who's llloooonggg on CAN DO spirit! He has a touch of IVDD and it doesn't hold him back at all. His foster mom has been helping him rewind the clock, getting stronger and faster - the faster he can go, the more in control he is and feels! Walks and runs keep him in great shape. He loves everyone he meets and he's great with dogs around his size too!

He's healthy and neutered, vaccinated and has been on preventatives. His person or people will understand his condition is not a limiting life factor, but does need light accomodation. They will help him continue to flourish for years to come while he rewards them HANDSOMEly with all the cuddles and companionship!

While he's in his foster home he receives his care from the Classic Canines medical sponsorship program in an outside clinic, keeping him tip top and ready for his adoption. Full medical records are available.

name: Dusty Rhodes
description_html:
If you‚Äôre looking for a gentle, affectionate companion who will adore you with his whole heart, Dusty is your guy! This sweet, soft-souled pup lives for cuddles and connection. His favorite place in the world is right beside his person ‚Äî whether that means following you from room to room, curling up at your feet, or tucking his nose under your arm for a cozy nap.

Dusty has lived through some rough chapters, but you‚Äôd never know it by his big heart and tail-wagging optimism. After arriving at the shelter in tough shape and spending time in the ICU, he‚Äôs now fully recovered, and soaking up every cuddle he can get from his adoring fans. Dusty has wonderful manners, too. He‚Äôs fully house-trained, polite, and gentle when taking treats. He rarely barks, walks well on a leash, and gets along with every human he meets.  

Dusty‚Äôs ideal home is one where he can be close to his people and share lots of snuggles and love. He might even enjoy a dog friend with the right match and a slow introduction, although he'd be perfectly happy being the only dog. If you‚Äôve been wishing for a sweet, playful, loyal, heart-melting companion, come meet Dusty. He‚Äôs ready to be someone‚Äôs perfect cuddle partner ‚Äî maybe yours! Come meet him and see why everyone‚Äôs smitten with this big-hearted guy!

name: Sunshine
description_html:
Ever dreamed of adopting a snuggly sunbeam with the emotional range of a soap-opera diva? Meet Sunshine, a six-year-old cattle dog/border collie mix who is 40% brilliance, 40% sass, and 20% ‚Äúma‚Äôam, this is a Wendy‚Äôs.‚Äù

At the shelter, Sunshine expresses her feelings through Bark, the ancient language of the Extremely Stressed. She performs this opera for anyone within a three-block radius. But it‚Äôs only because the shelter is a stressful place to be, and Sunshine knows she doesn‚Äôt belong here. She knows she is meant to live a life of leisure with humans who love her and keep her well stocked with treats and toys, and she will continue her protest of living here through barking loudly to ask to speak to the manager. 

Once she‚Äôs out of the shelter? She transforms. Suddenly she‚Äôs a polite, leash-walking, car-riding, house-trained queen (who only barks sometimes when she spots other dogs or animals, but in fairness to Sunshine, why are there ducks and geese at the park??) 

Sunshine is not here for your nonsense. She demands an adopter who appreciates a woman with boundaries, personality, a strong sense of fashion, and just a hint of chaos. She is affectionate, loyal, occasionally dramatic, and fully prepared to narrate the neighborhood gossip from your front window. She expects daily cuddle sessions, the last bite of whatever you‚Äôre eating, and for the photos saved on your phone to exclusively document her beauty. 

Sunshine doesn‚Äôt want to be perfect; she wants to be iconic. And she is.

If you‚Äôre ready to embrace a dog who sparkles, snuggles, and sasses her way into your heart, head to Austin Animal Services to meet Sunshine. She‚Äôs waiting to charm you‚Ä¶ loudly at first, and then forever. 

Email her agents at blueplusbusters@gmail.com to bring some Sunshine into your life.

name: Leon
description_html:
This handsome boy has a smile that lights up the whole shelter. Leon is sweet, kind and has the most gentle heart. He has become a volunteer favorite and is known for his easy-going nature.


He loves to take a nice long walk around campus. He is respectful and curious. Occasionally, he will roll on his back in the grass. This is when you know Leon is feeling confident and happy.


Leon also enjoys his time playing with toys in a play yard. He runs, jumps in the pool, rolls around in the dirt. He is an all-around happy, playful dog.


Leon has done very well on outings. He is a very good passenger in the car. You can feel his happiness as he relaxes. He enjoys exploring backyards with all the sights and sounds.


This handsome boy would make a wonderful addition to any family.

name: Phoenix
description_html:
Phoenix is a sweet, joyful boy with a heart full of love and curiosity. He‚Äôs been thriving in the play yard, where he enjoys long walks, sniffing everything around him, and splashing in the pool. Phoenix is a strong, energetic dog who loves keeping an eye on squirrels and birds, patrolling his surroundings with curiosity and excitement. He also absolutely loves playing fetch ‚Äî a yard or outdoor space would be a huge benefit for him.

While not the cuddliest, Phoenix shows affection in his own way, giving gentle kisses and leaning into those moments when he wants attention. He‚Äôs easy to harness, eager to explore, and quickly warms up to people, radiating sweetness despite what seems to have been a difficult past. His face and fur are healing beautifully, and his resilient, happy nature shines through every interaction.

Phoenix is looking for a family who will celebrate his energy, patience, and loving spirit ‚Äî someone who can give him space to run, sniff, and play while appreciating the gentle soul he is. Always smiling, Phoenix is truly a boy who leaves a lasting impression.

Ready for a rise through the adventure of life.

üåüPhoenix is also a celebrity after being featured on CBS Austin - check out his visit!

name: Sapphire
description_html:
Sapphire is striking with her beautiful eyes, and ears that like to pop and ping both individually and together. She loves to go on adventures and is great on the leash (and non reactive to pedestrians too)! She hops right in the car and stays in the back, though she‚Äôs always up for riding shotgun.


Our girl loves to swim! We‚Äôve noticed that many dogs who like the kiddie pools at the shelter tend to shy away from the big pools- but not Sapphire! She runs and jumps right in.


She loves to play but will stop and automatically sit (her way of politely asking for a treat). She‚Äôs a sweet, active, water babe who would love a home to call her own.

name: Bonnie Mae
description_html:
Bonnie Mae was in foster care and we learned so much about her! It was a full house with other pets, and while Bonnie Mae tolerated them, she may prefer to be either an only child or just have one feline or canine friend. She has perfect litter box manners and doesn't make a mess! Her favorite time of day is breakfast, lunch and dinner. Bonnie takes her meals seriously and will meow to remind you "it's time". She does need a little decompression time. After which she can be very affectionate and cuddly. Bonnie Mae is looking for her forever home today!

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage: http://www.desperatehousecats.info/flyers/BonnieMae6396.pdf
The adoption fee is waived for Bonnie Mae and all Desperate Housecats!

name: Alfred
description_html:
Alfred is a smart, active, and incredibly sweet boy who's eager to learn and loves having a job to do. He's fully housetrained, knows several words (especially "treat" and "food"), and will do just about anything for a piece of cheese.

He can be a little shy when meeting new people, but once he warms up, he's loyal, affectionate, and very devoted. Alfred is social with other dogs, does well with cats, and enjoys playing fetch, zooming around the yard, and keeping watch from his favorite window.

Athletic and graceful, Alfred runs like a gazelle but is just as happy soaking up ear scratches and butt rubs. With his brains, heart, and personality, he's ready to be a wonderful companion for the right family. üêæ

name: Patty Melt
description_html:
Meet Patty Melt


Patty Melt has the most adorable face and soulful brown eyes.

What can he do for you?

He's an easy home friend - very housetrained, quiet, relaxed and easy going.

He loves cuddle time with his people.

He walks nicely on a leash and if you're into walks, he's a great dog to have along.

Intelligence built in, he's well cued with his sit, shake, down and he takes treats nicely too!


Ready to check him out as your next companion? Click the link to alert his foster.

He's advocated for by his friends at caring@classiccanines.org who offer extra support for adopters. Find out why mature dog adoption is such an easy seamless fit for people of all ages.

name: Benji
description_html:
Meet Benji: Professional Squirrel Monitor & Champion Cuddler üê∂‚ú®

Benji is a young, playful, super sweet boy with two main life goals:

  1. Keep the backyard 100% squirrel-free, and
  2. Make sure he‚Äôs never too far from his toys, a cozy napping spot, or his human

He‚Äôs fully house-trained and knows how to be a very good boy at home. In his current foster home, he free-roams like the responsible adult he is. No chewed furniture, no chaos‚Äîjust good boy vibes. He‚Äôs even been left alone for long stretches and handled it like a champ.

Benji lives with a male dog and LOVES having a play buddy. When his dog friend isn‚Äôt in the mood, Benji has no problem entertaining himself with toys, bones, and solo playtime. When meeting new dogs, he sometimes comes in a little‚Ä¶ enthusiastic. Think ‚ÄúHi!Hi!Hi!Let‚ÄôsBeBestFriends!‚Äù right out of the gate. With proper introductions, he‚Äôs thrilled to make doggy friends.

Despite his playful energy, Benji takes his beauty rest very seriously and fits naps into his daily schedule like a true professional. He is a HUGE cuddle bug and firmly believes couches and beds exist specifically for snuggling. On work-from-home days, he‚Äôll either quietly entertain himself or snooze right next to your desk as your emotional support coworker.

Benji is also a total people-lover. Friends coming over? Best day ever. Male, female, doesn‚Äôt matter‚ÄîBenji is excited to say hello and will quickly wiggle his way into snuggle position on the couch.


If you‚Äôre looking for a dog who‚Äôs playful, affectionate, low-drama at home, and always down to cuddle, Benji is ready to move in and steal your heart (and probably your spot on the couch). üêæüíô

name: Ivan
description_html:
Meet Ivan


Ivan is a compact size that will fit right in with many home types! While he's a little guy, he has a large outlook on life and LOVES adventures. Ivan has been partnered with dog friends at the shelter, usually bigger than him, and he loves the companionship of another pup. He's housetrained and seems familiar with a crate too. He also checks all the boxes as a nice walking dog. If you're looking to add a fun dog to your life, whether you have another dog or you're flying solo, Ivan might be the little-big man for you! Plus, we have to say it: he kind of looks like an oversized pug -IYKYK - and how great would it be to have a pug-lookin' guy without the pug problems? See his big outing video here! Ivan has some advocates that are ready to help him leave shelter behind, at caring@classiccanines.org. Check in with staff or write to connect with his advocates; we can't wait to tell you all about him.

name: Tugboat
description_html:
Tugboat is an outdoorsy explorer with a big heart. At the shelter, his happiest moments are spent sniffing around quiet nature spots or working on a good chew toy. He‚Äôs an active dog who thrives when he has space to roam and play, and while the busy kennel environment can be stressful for him, volunteers have discovered his true personality during sleepovers and outings‚Äîaway from the noise, Tugboat blossoms into a joyful, affectionate companion.




This adventurous pup will happily patrol your yard for squirrels and make sure every toy gets its turn out of the basket. Once he knows you, Tugboat‚Äôs affectionate side shines through‚Äîhe loves belly rubs and will reward you with loyalty and warmth.




If you‚Äôre looking for a spirited friend who‚Äôs ready to join you on outdoor adventures and cuddle up afterward, Tugboat is waiting to be your sidekick.

name: Brandi
description_html: Brandi is working on building confidence in her interactions with people. She is shy until she gets to know you and then she enjoys gentle pets. We've added her to our Cactus Cat program to help her get a boost in social skills and trusting new people. Brandi likes Temptations treats so that may be a great ice-breaker when meeting her for the first time. Once she has deemed you worthy of friendship, she will let out a cute little meow at you to say 'hi'. She may do best in a low-traffic, quiet home where she can relax and get used to her new space. I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage: http://www.desperatehousecats.info/flyers/Brandi6516.pdf The adoption fee is waived for Brandi and all Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Munch
description_html: Munch is an energetic young Cattle Dog whose main priority in life is chasing a ball. If it bounces, he's after it! This spirited pup has an endless supply of enthusiasm for play, whether it's a game of fetch or a lively romp in the yard. He's quick on his feet, incredibly smart, and always ready for his next adventure. When he's not zooming around, you can find Munch mastering a new trick or scouting for the next throw. He's a loyal, fun-loving companion ready to bring excitement to any home!

name: Baron
description_html:
Baron is a volunteer favorite. He's been going on lots of adventures lately and we've learned a bit more about this boy.


He loves car rides and knows "want to go for a car ride". He also knows "want to go to the park". He's great on leash and isn't reactive to any pedestrian traffic (strollers, bikes, dogs, etc).


He's house trained and knows basic commands like sit and shake. Baron loves all things food which makes learning new commands a breeze.


He's one of the more confident dogs when out and about (he's not startled by loud sounds or neighborhood construction). He loves all bodies of water though is still getting used to pools.


At first Baron isn't a cuddly dog that wants pets and prefers to keep touch to a minimum. Once a relationship has been established though he isn't shy to ask for some love!


He's previously lived with a cat but can have a rowdy play style with them. Slow introductions and initial separation would be needed.


Baron can live in a home or an apartment. If you like being active, going on adventures, going for car rides, and the water - he is your boy!

name: Zariah
description_html:
If you‚Äôre looking for a dog who loves with her whole heart, meet Zariah. She‚Äôs an affectionate, cuddle-forward girl who leans right into you, melts for belly rubs, and happily offers her forehead for kisses. When she‚Äôs not snuggling, she‚Äôs carrying a toy around the yard and making herself laugh ‚Äî she can play happily on her own and then trot over for more love.


Zariah walks nicely on leash, is treat-motivated, and appears house-trained. She enjoys the company of other dogs one-on-one but can get a little overwhelmed in bigger groups, so 1 dog sibling (or being the only pet) may suit her best. Thinking about adding her to your family? If you already have a dog at home, you can set up a meet & greet at the shelter to see if it's a good fit.


Zariah would love a home that offers:

‚úî Snuggle time and affection

‚úî Either no pets or a compatible dog friend

‚úî Toys and enrichment ‚Äî she lives for them


This joyful, loving, playful girl just wants a person to adore.

Come meet Zariah ‚Äî she melts for anyone willing to lean in.

name: Zoodle
description_html:
Zoodle is a young, goofy bundle of energy who keeps everyone laughing. He‚Äôs still learning how to ‚Äúdog,‚Äù but he‚Äôs eager, smart, and always game to try. Toys are his love language ‚Äî and if there‚Äôs a pool around, he‚Äôs in it.


He‚Äôll splash, play, explore, and then come back ready to learn whatever you want to teach him. Zoodle brings equal parts fun and potential ‚Äî the perfect mix for someone who wants a dog they can grow with and enjoy every step of the way.

name: Oscar
description_html:
Oscar, with his handsome brindle coat, is a sweet boy with a love for adventure! This pup thrives on exploration, whether he's hitting the trails, engaging in puzzle toys, or sniffing out new scents and romping around on walks. Oscar also loves kongs, squeaky toys, and squirrel watching through the window!

Oscar is a playful and loyal dog, ready for his forever home and someone or a family who can help him build his confidence through fun new experiences. He may be a little shy with unfamiliar things, but that quickly melts away with a few delicious treats and a dose of love. He'll soon be cuddling up with you, ready to be your devoted best friend!

name: Bunny
description_html:
Meet Bunny

This sweet lady came to the shelter in urgent need of safety and care. She came from a tough situation and her condition was rough. She's spent the last few months on an amazing journey back to wellness, and to increased mobility. Bunny can now do everything that dogs do - besides being a great guest at home, she's house trained, she enjoys a little yard time and sunshine on her face. Short walks for exercise help her muscle strength. She's also a fish while guided in a swimming pool. She gives and receives so many affections. She's earned a reputation as a lap dog.


Bunny has a condition that makes her wobbly and unsteady on her feet, but she is aided by standard traction helpers like rugs, mats and being on flat surfaces when outdoors. Her Help Em Up harness also makes things a whole lot easier to guide her when needed. Bunny will do best in a single story arrangement as an only animal in her home.


Bunny's care includes occasional skin and eye management, and keeping her muscles in good tone. Her advocates at ClassicCaninesATX have been providing her care at an outside clinic and will help with supplies and some future veterinary care funding for an adopter.


Are you ready to make a difference in the life of a lady that has come this far already to prepare to meet you? Are you the person who will welcome her to unconditional forever love? Put her on your short list - and reach out on her link to talk with her foster provider or contact caring@classiccanines.org with questions about adoption support.


Watch her Pet of the Week highlight here!


See portions of Bunny's journey over the past few months here and here

name: Elly
description_html:
Hi, I‚Äôm Elly ‚Äî a tiny bundle of love looking for my forever person!


I may be small, but my heart is huge. My favorite things in the world are cuddling, giving kisses, and being as close to my people as possible. I‚Äôm the perfect size for apartment living, and I promise to fill every corner of your home with love (and the occasional squeaky-toy soundtrack).


I‚Äôm a total co-pilot and absolutely love car rides ‚Äî especially sitting shotgun with my head resting on the center console. I also have a soft spot for stuffy toys and enjoy proudly parading around with one in my mouth like a little prize.


I‚Äôm a smart girl, too! I already know sit, down, and roll over, and I‚Äôm eager to keep learning with my future human.


Last summer, I tried a pool for the first time and, to my surprise, I liked it! I wasn‚Äôt swimming laps, but I enjoyed splashing around and exploring the water. I also get along great with other dogs and would love a furry friend to cuddle with when we‚Äôre not out adventuring.


I‚Äôve even met a cat before! I was curious and tried to say hello, but when he set a boundary, I understood. With slow introductions and a cat who‚Äôs used to dogs, I think we could absolutely learn to coexist and maybe even become friends.


If you‚Äôre looking for a sweet, snuggly little shadow who will brighten your days and happily stick by your side, I might just be your girl.

name: Chicharr√≥n
description_html:
Meet Chicharr√≥n ‚Äì the ultimate good boy with a heart of gold and a nose for adventure! üêæüßÄüíõ

Chicharr√≥n is a sweet, playful pup who‚Äôs just as happy trotting along on a leash sniffing the breeze as he is squeaking every toy in the basket. He‚Äôs a soft, gentle player with other dogs and loves making new human friends‚Äîespecially if belly rubs are on the table!

This charming boy recently had a field trip to a foster home and absolutely nailed it. He was completely house-trained (not a single accident!), respectful indoors, and settled in beautifully. His one hilarious misstep? He couldn‚Äôt resist hopping on the counter to check out a forgotten bag of cheese‚Äîbut hey, can you blame him? One quick ‚Äúoff‚Äù and he was back to being the perfect guest. No repeats, just good boy energy from then on.

He explored the home calmly, played with every squeaky toy, and then curled up on the couch for a cozy nap. When a familiar friend came to visit, Chicharr√≥n greeted her with happy wiggles and calm excitement‚Äîclearly a dog who knows how to balance joy and manners.

He also did great in the car, hopping right in, entertaining himself with toys in the backseat, and taking in the world through the window with quiet curiosity.

Chicharr√≥n is the total package: house-savvy, leash-lovin‚Äô, toy-obsessed, and full of affection. If you‚Äôre looking for a loyal companion who‚Äôs equal parts playful and chill, this very good boy is ready to be your new best friend.

Adopt Chicharr√≥n and bring home a dog who‚Äôs already mastered the art of being wonderful. üê∂üí´


If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Piper
description_html:
Piper is a sweet cattle dog mix who is always smiling!

He likes to run around like an agility pro, go after a tossed toy, and then walk home with ease right next to you. She is on the smaller size and is very sweet. Clearly she is smart and would do well with someone who is active.


She is a volunteer favorite - sometimes even getting out of kennel twice a day!


Come see why all the volunteers love Piper!

name: York
description_html:
All York wants in life is to be cuddled and snuggled and loved on - it's his very favorite activity! His whole booty wiggles with excitement when you give him even the smallest bit of affection. Sometimes he likes to fall asleep snuggled on top of his foster mom when they are both laying on the couch, his whole body sprawled out on top of her like the best blanket ever. At bedtime, he likes to burrow under the blankets next to his human.

Life in the shelter was really hard for York, but he transitioned with ease to the comforts of his foster home, and now it's time for him to make his final transition into his forever home before his time in foster comes to an end. He's got all the great qualities - house-trained, non-destructive when left alone, loves people, enjoys playing with other dogs, playful, good with kids, and oh-so-sweet. "Tender little muffin man" is how one of his volunteer besties describes him.

To learn more about sweet York, press the "Get Started" button!

name: Parker
description_html:
Looking for a dog who will keep you laughing and melt your heart? Meet Parker, the goofball extraordinaire who believes life‚Äôs too short not to have fun!


Parker will greet you with an enthusiastic play bow like he‚Äôs saying, ‚ÄúHey friend, wanna party?‚Äù He‚Äôs got jokes, charm, and is absolutely adorable.


This lovable guy is also full of sweet surprises: he appears very house trained, walks beautifully on a leash, and gives the best cuddles in town. (Fair warning: if you dare to stop petting him, he‚Äôll politely remind you that you‚Äôre not done yet.)


Parker loves treats, attention, and anyone who appreciates his comedic genius. He‚Äôs affectionate, hilarious, and guaranteed to make every day brighter.


If your home could use a daily dose of laughter, love, and tail-wagging joy ‚Äî Parker‚Äôs your guy!


If you have any questions please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Chispita
description_html:
Chispita brings a sparkle to everyone‚Äôs lives! She was brought to AAS because her tail was dislocated (it was yanked hard, which left her incontinent). Her tail was surgically removed, and she was placed in foster care to recover.

Chispita made an excellent recovery, and is no longer incontinent. She does occasionally leave hard pellets of poop outside the litterbox, or a few drops of urine. To minimize these accidents, her foster mom keeps her bob hair trimmed, and cleans her bottom with a moist wipe.

Chispita is very social, friendly, affectionate, and playful. She is a lap cat, and loves to be around humans. She is great with other cats.

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Chispita and ALL Desperate Housecats!

name: Xander
description_html:
Xander is a young pup who wears his heart right on his furry sleeve. His love language is pure affection ‚Äî gentle lean-ins, soft eyes, and that happy little tail thump when he knows you‚Äôre paying attention. He adores people in the sweetest, most earnest way, and being near his humans is truly his favorite place to be.

He recently graduated from "Rowdy Manners class", where he not only learned his skills ‚Äî he also kept everyone laughing. Xander was the class clown in the best way: goofy, charming, and always ready to bring a smile to the room while still trying his hardest to get things right.

He‚Äôs also dog social, making friends easily and reading play cues like a natural. Even after finishing class, he‚Äôs still practicing his good manners on volunteer outings, taking in the world with that bright, eager expression that says he genuinely wants to do well.

Xander is young, learning, and growing into himself, but he‚Äôs already showing all the signs of being a dog who will bond deeply with his family and be a joy to share a home with.

Sweet, affectionate, social, and the kind of pup who lights up every space he‚Äôs in ‚Äî Xander is ready for someone to love, and to love him right back.

name: Alexis Rose
description_html:
Volunteers who know this unique-looking and "easy" dog are puzzled why she's still at the shelter!


Alexis Rose is a bit shy at first, but a volunteer who took her on an outing recently noted she is very calm in the car and seems to enjoy a car ride. Once at the park, she loved to walk and sniff around. Bikes zooming by were scary, though - everything was a bit "new" to her - but with treats and reassurance from her walker, she was able to cope very well. If your'e familiar with the show Schitt's Creek, she was named after Alexis Rose for her stunning blue eyes, but please know that she's MUCH less fussy than her namesake.


Alexis had a 2-week break in a foster home recently where her typically timed self started coming out of her shelf and showing her more playful and energetic side and even starting to cuddle!


The foster had to bring her back as they were looking for more of a couch potato, and so we hope Alexis's time is near for an adopter! This pretty girl is comfortable with other dogs and might even prefer it! She is looking for a home where she can relax and come out of her shell - we're sure no one has seen her shine completely yet! Will it be you?

name: Sky
description_html:
Hi, I'm Sky and I'm always here with a smile, waiting for you. My loves in life:

-People, big and small

-Climate control

-Affections and cuddles

-I'm a bit of a foodie and you can help me with my veggies

-A soft place to lay down and rest

-I love a little sunbathing here and there, and a roll in the grass

I'm super house trained, I have plenty of good home living experience.

I can stay home alone no problem.

I lost my home when my owner went into hospice.

I have helped a cancer patient cope with life.

I'm always widening my friends list and I hope you want to be on it, choose me!

name: Roo
description_html:
Would you like to adopt a very special cat? Roo is definitely special, and worth a little extra effort. She has a neurological condition that affects her balance and coordination (she wobbles when she walks). We believe that Roo was born with this condition, and it will probably not worsen or improve with time. She requires a large litterbox so that she doesn't miss (her foster dad customized one, and it goes with her when she's adopted). 

Roo is an extremely happy, affectionate cat. She is playful (her fave is a wand toy), and she loves nothing more than to be in a lap and snuggle. She walks around well on tile floors, but she does best on carpeting. She can't jump or climb, so a low window that she can look out would be ideal.

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage: http://www.desperatehousecats.info/flyers/Roo7099.pdf

The adoption fee is waived for Roo and all Desperate Housecats!

name: Ariel
description_html: Ariel is a gem! She's sweet as pie and so gentle and joyful. She's house trained, crate trained, and gets along great with other dogs - an absolute trifecta. She loves a good squeaky toy and to lean against her person for some snuggles. Visitors? No problem! Ariel is friendly and welcoming to all - a great phrase to describe her is "easy peasy." If you're looking for a sweet, affectionate dog who's always up for some fun, Ariel is your girl!

name: Baby Girl
description_html:
Sweet Baby Girl just wants to be by your side, be it snuggling on the couch, or sniffing around while walking with you.


Baby Girl is a dream on the leash, house trained, dog friendly, calm and playful.


Come meet her and fall in love with your new BFF.

name: Migo
description_html: Migo has a quiet confidence that makes him instantly likable. He‚Äôs the strong, silent type who won‚Äôt demand your attention, but absolutely melts when he has it. He enjoys going for walks, gets along beautifully with other dogs, and greets new friends with a gentle wag. Already housetrained and easygoing, Migo is ready to slip seamlessly into someone‚Äôs daily routine. He‚Äôs affectionate in the softest, sweetest way ‚Äî the kind of dog who sits close and lets you know he‚Äôs there for you.

name: Radar
description_html:
Radar is the definition of a happy-go-lucky dog! This handsome guy absolutely adores people ‚Äî he‚Äôs the first to greet you with a big smile, a wagging tail, and probably a jump (just his way of saying ‚ÄúI love you!‚Äù).

Radar‚Äôs a social butterfly who thrives on attention and affection. He loves to snuggle, give kisses, and follow you around like your biggest fan. Playtime is one of his favorite parts of the day ‚Äî whether it‚Äôs squeaky toys, a puzzle or a plush toy, he will be happy to play right beside you while you chill and Netflix.

If you‚Äôre looking for a sweet, loving, and playful companion who will fill your days with laughter and love, Radar‚Äôs your guy. Come meet him ‚Äî he can‚Äôt wait to meet you!

name: Panda
description_html:
I‚Äôm a big, lanky, wormy, squirmy boy with a heart of gold and legs for days!

I‚Äôm a playful goofball who loves to have fun, and I‚Äôd be over the moon to have another playful dog friend in my new home. I adore romping around, wrestling, playing chase, and especially playing fetch‚Äîthrow the ball, and I‚Äôm on it! I also really enjoy water, so kiddie pools, sprinklers, or creek adventures are totally my thing.

Walks are one of my favorite parts of the day. I walk loosely on the leash and love to trot right alongside you, whether we‚Äôre out for a casual stroll or a nice run. I‚Äôm a good boy who wants to obey; I already know sit and stay, and I‚Äôm eager to learn more. I take treats very gently, so training time is fun and easy with me.

I‚Äôm currently being taken care of by my foster dad, and I really love getting attention and affection. When you start petting me, I tend to flop dramatically onto the ground and roll over to show you my belly...it‚Äôs my specialty move! I‚Äôm a big sweetheart who just wants to be close, soak up love, and be your goofy sidekick.

If you‚Äôre looking for a sweet, silly, water-loving best friend with a big heart, goofy grin, and a lot of love for snacks, I‚Äôm your guy!

name: Koozie
description_html: Sweet Koozie who we call ‚ÄúRoo‚Äù because her ears bounce while we walk. She‚Äôs an energetic girl who LOVES playing with other dogs. She has a rowdy play style but takes corrections well if necessary. While she does take some time to warm up to humans, she has learned humans can be safe and regularly solicits affection. She sleeps well overnight in her crate as long as she can see you. She‚Äôs would thrive with another confident and playful dog. She‚Äôs learning leash manners but would make an excellent running buddy for someone.

name: Ashley
description_html:
Ashley ‚Äî or Ash, as her friends call her ‚Äî is a sweet, affectionate girl who thrives on connection. She loves being close to her people and happily follows along like a loyal little shadow, always ready to offer kisses, cuddles, and companionship.


Ash is people-friendly and very cuddly, greeting familiar faces with enthusiasm and making sure no one walks past her without saying hello. She‚Äôs playful and social with other dogs and enjoys being part of the action, whether that‚Äôs a walk, a play session, or some quiet time together once she‚Äôs had a chance to burn off a little energy.


On leash, Ash can tug a bit at first but settles into an easygoing walk, especially when she gets time to sniff and explore. She‚Äôs treat-motivated and clever ‚Äî she already knows ‚Äúsit‚Äù and ‚Äúcome,‚Äù and has even learned that sitting politely earns her snacks. She also enjoys carrying toys around and chewing on her favorites, a classic puppy habit that adds to her charm.


Ash would likely do well in a variety of home setups, including apartments or houses, as long as she gets regular walks, playtime, and plenty of affection. She‚Äôs active, playful, and loving ‚Äî a wonderful match for someone looking for a dog who wants to be truly involved in their daily life.

name: Fritz
description_html:
Fritz is a happy-go-lucky guy who brings good vibes everywhere he goes. Easygoing, well-adjusted, and always smiling, he rolls with whatever the day brings‚Äîwalks, playtime, meeting new people‚Äîhe‚Äôs just happy to be included.


If you‚Äôre looking for a dog with a great personality and an even better attitude, Fritz is the kind of companion who makes life feel a little lighter and a lot more fun.

name: Milton
description_html:
Milton is a smart, happy, goofball! This charming brindle and white dog, with his irresistible smile and waggy tail, is joy personified. Milton's signature look often includes his tongue playfully flopped out, a testament to his lighthearted and enthusiastic spirit. He's a lover of all things fun ‚Äì a squeaky toy chase, a comfy couch for lounging, and especially, quality time with his favorite humans. 

Milton thrives on affection and is always ready to show off happy wiggles as he leans in for pets. He has a good mix of energy, always ready for a walk to do his business (he‚Äôs very housetrained), and to sniff around, as well as chill cuddle time. If you're seeking a loyal, affectionate, and utterly delightful companion to brighten your days, Milton is waiting to steal your heart. Meet him today!

name: Lilly
description_html:
Meet Lilly! She is a sweet and goofy puppy who is ready to steal your heart (and your socks)! It may take her a little while to warm up to you, but once she gets to know you, she won‚Äôt want to leave your side.


Lilly would do best in a home with other friendly dogs. Her ideal family is active or has a backyard that she can run around in. While she loves to cuddle up for a nap, she still has puppy energy and wouldn‚Äôt do well pent up in an apartment without plenty of walks. She is crate trained (although she may whine a little), nearly housebroken, and very treat motivated.


Lilly has already come leaps and bounds since we began fostering her. When we picked her up from AAC, she was shut down and wouldn‚Äôt leave the spot by the front door for two days. Now, she cuddles with us, plays tug-of-war with her foster sisters, greets our guests without barking, and has made friends with many of the dogs in our neighborhood. We are sure that this is just the beginning and that she will continue to blossom into a great companion. 


If you‚Äôd like to meet Lilly or learn more about her, don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out!

name: Walrus
description_html:
Walrus is a big-hearted lovebug with the most sincere, soul-melting eyes you‚Äôll ever meet. This sweet boy lives for the simple joys in life: long, leisurely walks where he can sniff every interesting smell, and plenty of cozy cuddle time where he can soak up all the love and affection you‚Äôre willing to give.


Shelter life has been tough on sensitive Walrus, and it‚Äôs starting to weigh on his gentle spirit. What he truly needs is a calm, loving forever home where he can finally relax, feel safe, and be someone‚Äôs cherished best friend. The good news? Walrus is already fully house trained and ready to settle right into home life like a pro.


Walrus is dog-selective, meaning he may be able to get along or peacefully coexist with certain dogs with proper introductions. With the right match and a little patience, he can thrive.


If you‚Äôre looking for a loyal companion who will walk by your side and curl up in your arms at the end of the day, Walrus just might be your perfect match. He‚Äôs ready to give his whole heart; he just needs someone to give him a chance.

name: Walter
description_html:
Meet Walter!
Looking for the ultimate cuddle buddy? Walter is your guy! This sweet, gentle boy is the biggest lap dog you'll ever meet-he'll happily trade playtime for snuggles any day. Walter is a dream on the leash, making walks calm and easy, and he absolutely adores spending time with his volunteer friends.

With his loving nature and gentle heart, Walter is ready to bring joy and comfort to a forever home. He's the kind of dog who will always be by your side, whether you're out for a stroll or curled up on the couch.

Whoever gets to love Walter is going to be one very lucky person!

name: Emmitt
description_html:
Our boy Emmitt has loved going on adventures outside of the shelter, and it‚Äôs helping us learn more about this very good boy. Inside a home we found him to be so loving. He enjoys having a variety of toys to play with, but doing so right next to his people. He‚Äôs a multitasker who likes to play and snuggle at the same time. His signature move on a couch is to put his butt in the air and his head in your lap. This sweetheart is a bouncy ball of fun. At the shelter he loves going for walks, playing fetch in the play yards, or snuggling in the real life rooms.


Emmitt is also very house trained and knows a few tricks. He‚Äôs always up for a snack which make adding new tricks to his resume a breeze.


We‚Äôd love to see Emmitt in a home with daily walks, a bit of fetch, a full belly, and some extra snuggles.

name: Rocky
description_html:
Meet Rocky


He's an adorable budding prince. You'll find him waiting by his kennel, with a smile and a tilted head because he really wants to connect with you. He hopes you might stop at his kennel, and stay more than a couple seconds to meet him. He's very smart, a craft in the making, and he looks for guidance from his person. His VIP will help him finesse his leash skills, after all he's just a youngster still learning. He has the foundation of becoming a heart dog for his person for a lifetime.

name: Whitley
description_html:
Whitley is a sweet and adorable girl who is full of love and energy! She's friendly with everyone she meets and adores being close to her humans, cuddling up whenever she can.

She loves playing fetch, chasing toys, and showing off her incredible zoomies. A yard or an active adopter would be a dream for her. She also has the potential to share her forever home with a dog sibling.

Whitley was being cared for by our medical team for the beginning of her stay with us, so we think this petite lady was just overlooked! But now she's happy, healthy, and ready to start her life and leave her kennel behind.

If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Tonka
description_html:
Tonka is a pure bundle of joy who truly loves everything life has to offer: toys, walks, treats, water, and especially his beloved people friends! He could even join a family with a well-matched canine companion after a meet & greet with shelter staff.

One thing that sets Tonka apart is that he is deaf, which a volunteer noted is a huge asset! During his overnight stay, he "did so so good," adapting quickly to a new home and enjoying outings to sports bars and a friend's house. Being deaf helped him stay calm and stress-free in normally loud environments.

Deaf dogs are trained using hand signals and visual cues with positive reinforcement, and they live just like hearing dogs! For safety, they should always be leashed outside a securely fenced yard. Adopting a deaf dog like Tonka is incredibly rewarding, and there are many resources available to help you.

Tonka is well-behaved, quickly adapts, and is ready to shower his new family with unconditional love!

name: Paxton
description_html:
Meet Paxton

Where sweet meets savory you'll find this easy going friend with his dashing good looks. As a mature man, he knows his true loves, being around his people, quiet time with his stuffies and chews, easy relaxing, leisure napping, and having a roll in the grass and a little sploot of sunbathing is the cherry on top.


Paxton's very housetrained (never marking!), stays home alone well, and is respectfully QUIET for the sake of your work at home, and your neighbors.


Paxton's former life was not always kind. He arrived with taped paws and walking gingerly until healed, he has an old fracture across his neck area and his hips and spine have seen the wear and tear of a dog that has pounded some pavement. That's why finding his happily ever after is so very important, along with finding the person who will make the difference in his life. It's time. Paxton has earned a normal dog's life.
